Coleen Nolan has admitted to ‘smacking’ her grown-up sons when they were children. 
The mum of three made the admission on Loose Women during a discussion about aggressive kids. 
The 51 year old’s sons Jake Roche, 24, and Shane Jr., 28, might be grown up now, but she admitted that she struggled to control them as children. 
“There were times when I smacked my boys because they were, I can’t swear on telly, little poo bags,” Coleen admitted. Coleen Nolan admitted to 'smacking' her boys on Loose Women (Photo: ITV) Mum of three admitted the boys were hard to handle (Photo: ITV) 
“I don’t mean I battered them it wasn't abuse,” she clarified. 
"But I smacked them on the back of the legs or the hand." 
She also reasoned that her boys “haven’t grown up violent” because of her actions. Coleen never struck her daughter Ciara (Photo: ITV) Coleen made the frank admission on Loose Women (Photo: ITV) 
But Coleen added that she has never felt the need to “smack” her 15-year-old daughter Ciara. 
“Ciara I’ve never smacked, now even on the hand,” she said. 
She explained: “Ciara’s always responded to a look or a tone of voice when she was little but the boys were wilder.” Shane Richie with Coleen Nolan and sons Jake and Shane (Photo: Scope Features) 
But Coleen added that her husband Ray Fensome changed her son Jake’s life. 
“Ray changed Jake’s life really,” she said. 
“He taught him there has to be consequences so if he was grounded, he’d be grounded.” Like us on Facebook
